title: Speech functions found in SBY's speech script entitled the case of Century Bank and Bibit-Chandra
abstract: This research is focusing on the application of the speech function types in SBY’s speech script entitled The Case of Century Bank and Bibit-Chandra. In this thesis, the writer has two statements of the problem. The first one is to identify the types of speech functions that occur in the script and then the writer also want to find out the type of speech function that occur the most in the script. The theory that the writer used to analyze this research is from Van Ek’s theory. It is a theory about speech functions and its types of speech functions. By using the descriptive method, the writer calculated some statistic data to form a descriptive conclusion. The finding that Indonesian people expect is that He would give them an answer about the continuation of that case. However, the imparting and seeking factual information is the most frequent type that occurs in the script. People expect that there should be many sentences that showed what he has done for that case. It did not happen. Therefore, Indonesian people are not satisfied with SBY’s speech at that time.
contributors: Flora Debora (Advisor 1); Prof. Dra. Ester Harijanti Kuntjara, MA., Ph.D. (Examination Committee 1)
